@ecchiako While in a satirical way, the doujin itself presents the truth: "humans want to copulate, duh." It goes beyond the physical act, having plenty of possible social implications. Catholic priesthood revolves around negating all this to dedicate to religion itself. Yeah, there is charity too, I guess... But the two aren't necessary to each other.

Long story short, from a logical perspective, there is moral gain on celibate, and no moral loss on ignoring it. Rules without purposes to the ones following them are worthless no matter the amount of followers that pledge to them.

I may come off as a hypocrite because I despise NTR with every fiber of my being, but people crying in the comments about a "good" or "holy" person having their chastity stolen and whatever and saying it's disgusting are so unbelievably stupid. People with nun fetishes are two sides of the same coin. You either like nuns in wholesome doujins where they're married and the sex is consensual and everything or you're the exact opposite. The opposite being you're into the corruption of nuns who are turned into cock-loving whores who will spread their legs in the blink of an eye. I suppose you could also just be into the outfit and none of the context matters. Again I may sound like a hypocrite, but at the end of the day, this is just a collection of lines and dialogue and none of the characters involved actually have feelings.
